verses.verse: Μετὰ <WG3326> Meta When ( Paul in Macedonia and Greece) δὲ <WG1161> de - τὸ <WG3588> to - παύσασθαι <WG3973> pausasthai had ended , τὸν <WG3588> ton the θόρυβον <WG2351> thorybon uproar μεταπεμψάμενος <WG3343> metapempsamenos sent for ὁ <WG3588> ho - Παῦλος <WG3972> Paulos Paul τοὺς <WG3588> tous the μαθητὰς <WG3101> mathētas disciples . καὶ <WG2532> kai And παρακαλέσας <WG3870> parakalesas after encouraging [them] , ἀσπασάμενος <WG782> aspasamenos he said goodbye [to them] ἐξῆλθεν <WG1831> exēlthen [and] left πορεύεσθαι <WG4198> poreuesthai for εἰς <WG1519> eis . . . Μακεδονίαν <WG3109> Makedonian Macedonia .

( Literally from Asia; Asia was a Roman province in what is now western Turkey; also in verses 16 and 18.) δὲ <WG1161> de and Τυχικὸς <WG5190> Tychikos Tychicus καὶ <WG2532> kai and Τρόφιμος <WG5161> Trophimos Trophimus

οὗτοι <WG3778> houtoi These [men] δὲ <WG1161> de - προελθόντες <WG4281> proelthontes went on ahead ἔμενον <WG3306> emenon [and] waited for ἡμᾶς <WG1473> hēmas us ἐν <WG1722> en in Τρῳάδι <WG5174> Trōadi Troas .
